value.name: Delaware judge reaffirms ruling rejecting Elon Musk’s massive Tesla pay package
value.description: Chancellor Kathaleen St. Jude McCormick on Monday denied a request by attorneys for Musk and Tesla’s corporate directors to vacate her ruling earlier this year requiring the company to rescind the unprecedented pay package.

value.name: Endicott College holds vigil for police officer killed in wrong-way crash
value.description: A man from Exeter who was a police officer at Endicott College is being mourned after he was killed in a crash in Massachusetts early Thanksgiving morning.

video.name: Endicott College holds vigil for police officer killed in wrong-way crash

value.name: Delaware judge rejects request to restore Musk's $56 billion Tesla pay
value.description: A Delaware judge ruled on Monday that Tesla CEO Elon Musk still is not entitled to receive a $56 billion compensation package despite shareholders of the electric vehicle company voting to reinstate it.

value.name: Delaware judge rejects Elon Musk's bid to reinstate his $56 billion pay package
value.description: Musk's legal team argued that McCormick should reverse her earlier decision because Tesla had conducted a shareholder vote to “ratify” the 2018 pay plan at the company's annual shareholder meeting in June.

value.name: Judge rejects Tesla's attempt to revive Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package
value.description: A Delaware judge ruled Monday that a Tesla shareholder vote endorsing a $56 billion pay package for Elon Musk does not change her original ruling invalidating the compensation plan.

value.name: Delaware judge strikes down Elon Musk's Tesla pay package for 2nd time
value.description: Tesla shareholders approved Elon Musk's pay package in June, after it was voided by a judge in January. But that wasn't enough, the court ruled.

value.name: Tesla CEO Elon Musk loses bid to get $56 billion pay package reinstated
value.description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk lost his bid to get his 2018 CEO pay package reinstated on Monday when a Delaware judge upheld her prior ruling that the compensation plan was improperly granted.

value.name: Musk $55.8 bn Tesla pay deal again rejected by US judge
value.description: A US judge on Monday upheld her decision to reject Elon Musk's massive $55.8 billion compensation package at Tesla, denying an attempt to restore the pay deal through a shareholder vote. In a court filing,

value.name: Judge reaffirms ruling invalidating Musk's multibillion-dollar Tesla pay package
value.description: McCormick also rejected an equally unprecedented and massive fee request by plaintiff attorneys, who argued that they were entitled to legal fees in the form of Tesla stock valued at more than $5 billion. The judge said the attorneys were entitled to a fee award of $345 million.

video.name: Delaware judge reaffirms ruling that invalidated massive Tesla pay package for Elon Musk

value.name: Tesla's FSD Can Finally Park, Though Sometimes It Aims For The Sidewalk
value.description: FSD version 13.2 is a big improvement over version 12. It not only makes the autonomous driving better and smoother, but it also adds new features. You can now enable FSD while the car is in Park, and it will reverse out of the parking spot for you and begin its journey to your set destination where it will find a suitable spot to park itself.

about.name: Elon Musk: The Real Life Iron Man

value.name: Delaware judge rejects request to restore Elon Musk's $56 billion Tesla pay
value.description: The ruling by the judge follows her January decision that called the pay package excessive and rescinded it, surprising investors.

value.name: 18-year-old Acreage man dies when motorcycle crashes with Tesla in Westlake, PBSO says
value.description: Derek Hedrill Machin of The Acreage died in the wreck Saturday night along Seminole Pratt Whitney Road, deputies said.

value.name: Judge rejects Elon Musk request to reinstate his $56 billion pay package
value.description: Elon Musk was seeking to reinstate a massive 2018 Tesla pay package after shareholders had reapproved it, but a judge denied his request.

value.name: Elon Musk’s $56 billion pay package gets rejected — again
value.description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s $56 billion pay package was struck down once again. In a ruling on Monday, Delaware Chancery Court Judge Kathaleen St. J. McCormick upheld her decision to block the compensation plan over concerns about conflicts of interest following its approval in 2018.

value.name: Elon Musk’s $50 Billion Tesla Pay Can’t Be Reinstated, Delaware Judge Rules
value.description: The judge said she would not reverse her decision to strike down the compensation package after Tesla shareholders approved Mr. Musk’s pay a second time.

value.name: Elon Musk’s $56B Tesla pay package rejected again by Delaware judge
value.description: McCormick also ordered Tesla to pay the attorneys who brought the case $345 million, well short of the $6 billion they initially requested.

video.name: Elon Musk’s $56B Tesla pay package rejected again by Delaware judge

value.name: Musk’s Multibillion-Dollar Pay Package Rejected Again by Judge
value.description: Tesla’s board had argued that a shareholder vote earlier this year addressed the court’s previous criticisms.

value.name: Elon Musk’s massive, multi-billion-dollar Tesla pay package was blocked by a judge again
value.description: Elon Musk’s record-breaking pay package for serving as Tesla’s CEO was rejected on Monday by a Delaware court, despite being approved by Tesla shareholders at a June meeting.

value.name: Tesla just announced over 25 holiday updates. These are the highlights.
value.description: Tesla owners will finally be able to adjust climate controls and open the frunk from their Apple Watch.

value.name: Tesla is launching an Apple Watch app
value.description: The native Apple Watch experience lets you view the charge status, pop the frunk, and remotely warm up your car. Third-party smartwatch apps such as “Watch for Tesla” added this functionality in the absence of a first-party solution, but now Tesla has Sherlocked them all.

value.name: Tesla's Self-Driving Narrative Is Falling Apart

value.name: Judge again rejects the Elon Musk Tesla pay plan now valued at $101 billion
value.description: A Delaware judge today rejected Elon Musk's bid to reinstate a Tesla pay package that was worth over $50 billion at the beginning of 2024 and has now crossed $100 billion based on Tesla's latest share price. The judge also ordered Tesla to pay $345 million in attorneys' fees to the plaintiff's counsel, who had sought $5.6 billion in fees.
